arts.sum: In a pulsating Serie A clash, Como secured their second consecutive victory with a hard-fought 3-2 win over Hellas Verona. The match was marked by Patrick Cutrone’s impressive brace and Andrea Belotti’s maiden goal for Como, but controversy erupted over the dismissal of Verona’s Tomas Suslov. Como entered the match riding high on their recent shock victory against Atalanta, while Verona sought to bounce back from consecutive losses to Lazio and Torino. arts.ttl: Como against Hellas Verona for the overtake
arts.sum: Como have drawn six of their 12 previous matches in Serie A against Hellas Verona (W3 L3), including the most recent one, on 9 April 1989 – against none of the opponents they have faced at least 10 times in the competition have they recorded a higher percentage of draws (50%, as against Avellino and Ascoli). Como are unbeaten in their six home matches against Verona in Serie A (W2 D4), only against Bologna have they played more home games in the competition without ever losing (10).
